review.comment: A big letdown, story felt rushed, it had no pace and the only cool thing about the show was Daredevil.

title: DAHMER - Monster: The Jeffrey Dahmer Story

review.comment: Great! Evan Peters nailed all the weird vibes!
Great show, interesting characters and intriguing conflicts, highly recommend!
Great show, with amazing performances!
Grog!!
I really liked that they made it as close to the original game as possible. Had such a great time watching it!
What a trip! I'm getting Fallout-vibes and some strange conspiracy-vibes from the whole thing. Super excited for whats to come!
The MCU is very hit or miss these days. I could have managed without seen this

I had really high hopes for this show. The first half was really good, but some of the acting really tore it back down. We tried to watch S2, but the storyline following Gaal and Sal was so boring. It's a shame, because the world is so interesting and Lee Pace really brought his great talent to this show.
What a great show! The family dynamic in this show is so intriguing and fucked up.
It was fun Star Wars show. I enjoyed the characters and the story it's setting up!
This family is something else. Great drama, great actors!
Still great! It stays consistent.
Grotesque, and also very entertaining! Felt like a parody of X-men.
Finally, something good again in the MCU.
I came across a video essay on YouTube about it, I saw 30 secs and I had to check out the show.A fantastic sci-fi cartoon!
The Marvel cartoon lived up to the hype. I enjoy the alternate stuff and the new characters they introduced!
Another Marvel show! I liked this one, reminded me a bit of Daredevil, but some of the action and story was very weird. Felt a bit rushed, but it was enjoyable.
This was great. The story was meh, but the acting and the main characters banter is very entertaining.
Fun, exciting, and jaw-dropping at some stages. I don't think I have ever seen anything like this from Guy Ritchie.

I discovered this by accident when reading comments somewhere. It was a really cool show that explores one of the most intriguing parts of humans and technology, and how that might work in the future.
The setting, acting, characters and much more is so interesting. I knew of the yakzua from before, but not like this.
Finally! This season had so much going on and the finale didn't end on a cliffhanger, but the other episodes makes waiting for S3 even more painful! I might just buy the comics.
This is one of the best video-game adaptations I've seen. They nailed the world, characters and the weirdness of everything. I have been thinking about this show for the last two weeks, I want more!
Same as S1, and but the acting in this season really escalated for everyone involved. Sato was our favorite.

Japan was a sureal place during the samurai-era. Every episode was able to keep us invested because how the characters were doubling crossing each other all of the place and performing seppuku seemed like it was just part of the every day.
Everyone was talking about it, and we also started to talk about it. Eerie and amazing at the same time.
Wow. They made a heartfelt cartoon, I mean, revived cartoon about mutants and a dab of time-travel. It was awesome!
Norwegian show about some rich/spolied white dudes that only parties, it has its moments.
Cool show. Some of the characters decisions were weird, and the flashbacks felt rushed.
Overall I enjoyed this season. I thought it would have a totally different ending.
Rewatch. It's a lot of fun!
Slow season, the acting and world-building was fantastic!
Rewatching the whole show. I find the world and characters more and more interesting!
Slow start, but great ending!
Rewatch! And now the fun begins!
Rewatching the show. Having so much fun!
Rewatch. I totally forgot how this season ended, fantastic!
Rewatch!
Rewatch. It was alright, the writing is more off than the other seasons.
It felt like a different show this season, I did enjoy it however, but the pacing felt off. Maybe they can catch-up for next season!
After years of convincing, my SO managed to get me to watch this show. It was pretty good, not the story I expected at all. The ending felt preditcable, but it was fun to watch!
Norwegian show about disconnecting and not using a smartphone in a year. Cool project, leanred lots!
Great show! Intense finale, was not expecting that!
This season took us a while. We never go hooked like the two previous seasons. The story felt like it was all over the place.
Lots of great epiosdes, some better than others. I enjoyed ep 4, 5, 6, 7, 8, 9 and 11 the most.
Just. Really. Terrible. Haven't seen any other Norwegian disaster movie, but if they are like this I don't want to watch them either.
Disappointed, felt like there was no stakes in this season at all. And it's a huge waste that this was the last season.
Great start, was captivated initially, but the ending was not so great. The last season had much more open ending whereas this season you know there will be season 3.
Awesome characters, haven't heard of any of them before except Weasel.
Fun show, lots of laughs and the acting was really good. It wasn't too serious, and the spy genre didn't disappoint.
The tension! Absolutely loved this season!
Almost relaxing TV-show, the atmosphere was great and I like Colin's voiceover. The twist was very unexpected.
People have hyped this up too much. It was mediocre at best. The last two episodes was better than the others.

It's the most intense entertainment I have ever seen. There's never a dull moment, and whenever I think a character is OK or when I start to care about someone... BAM! Something insane happens. I really liked the different storylines in this season in comparison to the other two seasons. Season 4 can't come soon enough!
Captivating from start to finish! After watching two seasons of this show I'm certain that I don't want to separate my work and personal life into two separate identities.
Excellent from start to finish! The story, characters, technology, and over all a really good show. All of the episodes lived up to the pilot/ep1.
Started of great, became more generic towards the end, but overall great season!

Intense, thought-provoking and incredible storytelling. How everything was one take, how everything felt fluid and believeable. I've never watched anything like it. Good characters, acting, and story overall.

The ending made the show better. Some stuff felt rushed, the CGI stuff in the first couple of episodes was so weird compared to the original Netflix series. The Punisher stuff was excellent! Hopefully we can see more of him in the future.
This took so long to finish. This season kept on getting more and more boring. And I had to find out how it ended, and I was surprised. But man was this boring...

title: Devil in the Family: The Fall of Ruby Franke

review.comment: WTF. When everything is content, and religion can be your excuse. I don't have fucking words.
The atmosphere in this show is excellent. The tone feels a lot more Star Wars than some of the other recent shows. The main characters is really something too.
Really good, but not the same as the previous season. I'm not too sold on Ellie's character. The other supporting characters was excellent.

An awesome crime, mafia, drama, etc etc, fucking TV show! It was a blast beginning to end! I loved all the characters. The twists were great. Not a lot I actually saw coming. I recommend this show to everyone that likes the crime/mafia genre. My last 10 Sundays have been an absolute blast!
It so much fun to watch these people run a farm 😂
Nearly perfect ending, except for introducing *** version of Squid Game. It did peak my interest if they are going to continue the story or end it there. Time will show.

It doesn't remind me much of the books, to be honest. The overall show was great, and the setting is really cool. But I want it to be more like the books. The tone was the only thing in the show that was off. It never really landed. It felt like they were trying to be funny and dramatic like Fallout, but it wasn't funny like that. Just more awkward 😅
It's bearly better than Ms. Marvel. I only watched it because one big character was introduced in the last episode. And Zeke was a cool character up until the end.
WTF... Nathan is so weird, and fucking awkward.
It's getting boring now. I just watch it to see if the "story" progresses.
This Nathan fellow is almost too dedicated to his craft!
This show has been recommended to me for a long long time, and now I understand what all the fuzz has been about. Looking forward to watching the rest!!

He's back, again! This new show makes up for the badly handled ending for the original show and the last episode of New Blood. The new show brings a lot more mysteries with it, new and old characters. They used what worked from New Blood, and removed what didn't. I'm hopeful for the contiunation of the story!
It's all connected! Drugs, murders, gangsters. Everything!

Cool story. It brings more depth to the aliens themselves, but I'm a bit confused by the timelines. This is before the first movie, but the characters in the first movie didn't know anything about the aliens. And the last minute in the finale is corny af.

I liked the retcon from season 1 from DCEU. It was fun seeing all the main characters playing alongside each other as friends throughout the whole season. And Vigilante, what a great character, the actor nails it. I want a spin-off show for just Vigilante with his vigilanting and interactions with his mom and day-to-day.

Excellent! More slow-paced compared to last season, and the same with the scale of the world building. The acting is great! All three main characters feels like three sperate player characters that has very different perks. Had a blast from start to finish.
